*Summary*: Totals for "Remaining" and "Estimate" times are not displaying in the following places in an agile board (scrum):

-- Time Tracking: Remaining Estimate and Time Spent

*Actual Outcome*: Totals do not display (as per screenshots).

*Additional Info*:
JIRA Cloud
Chrome 47 + Firefox
Worked fine several days ago—no settings/config have changed since that I am aware of.

Please let me know if you require any further info.
Thanks.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
End user is looking for a more streamline way of associating a ticket while moving it in JIRA Cloud. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to configure the "move issue" page to allow the association of an epic to a ticket while moving it instead of having to edit the ticket twice. 
h3. Workaround 
The current process looks like this.

# Clone ticket
# Move ticket to the correct project
# Edit issue's association to epic

There might be a way to customize this process by using [Bob's Swift Clone Plus|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JCPP] tool, unfortunately this is not available on JIRA Cloud.
fields.summary: Ability to edit move screen to allow epic association of a ticket

fields.description:
We are using JIRA version 6.2. 
Per the instructions:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH062/Configuring+Columns

Under the heading "Mapping Columns to JIRA Statuses"
We have never been able to "Map a status to a column - Drag a status from the Unmapped column to the appropriate column on the right."
What happens, upon performing the click action where you try to drag the status from the 'unmapped statuses' menu at left, the webpage height extends lower and lower and lower, with a red error message bar at the bottom of Chrome window, with an error message that can never be loaded.

I think in ie8 we used to be able to create a new column, with "add column" and then if we created the title of the column with the name of the status, then the status automatically mapped to the new column.

However, this no longer works. I am not certain if ie8 was relevent. but now we have ie11 and cant access ie8. 

So, thus, now, we have no way to create an agile board so that it has columns to display the project status.  This is a critical problem.

The default mapping, we get column 'In progress' with status ' in progress'.  However, we have no way to display on our Agile board our other statuses, for example 'backlog' or 'In Analysis' or 'Test Ready'
fields.summary: Unable to Configure Agile Board Columns - Mapping Columns to JIRA Statuses not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13032].
{panel}
h3. Summary

The Epic and Story description are wrong on the help page.
 * <instance-url>/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa?decorator=popup#IssueTypes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the instance click to create an issue;
 # On the right side of Issue Type click on the help button.

h3. Expected Results

Shows the right description.
h3. Actual Results
||Issue Type||Description Shown||
|Epic|gh.issue.epic.desc|
|Story|gh.issue.story.desc|
|Bug|jira.translation.issuetype.bug.name.desc|

It also shows these incorrect strings on the Issue Types page in administration.
h2. Workaround

(!) Always generate backup of your database before making any changes to it via SQL. Any workaround requiring SQL changes carries inherent risk so a backup of your DB is essential to restore working conditions if there is a critical problem.

1. Execute the following queries in your database:
   *If you are using languages other than English, please replace the description string in        queries with respective translation*
{code:java}
UPDATE issuetype SET description='A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.'
WHERE description='jira.translation.issuetype.bug.name.desc'{code}
{code:java}
UPDATE issuetype SET description='Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a big user story that needs to be broken down.'
WHERE description='gh.issue.epic.desc'{code}
{code:java}
UPDATE issuetype SET description='Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a user story.'
WHERE description='gh.issue.story.desc'{code}
2. Restart the JIRA instance
fields.summary: Description for Epic and Story are not showing on Issue Types or help page

fields.description:
If I have a board filter with an OR clause, the list of issues displayed in the Backlog on the Agile Board may differ from the list of issues displayed when I click the "View in Issue Navigator" button above the Backlog.

Suppose that I have a board with this filter:

Id = Sand-56 OR id = Sand-57 ORDER BY Rank ASC

Sand-56 is assigned to a sprint.  Sand-57 is not.  On my Agile Board, only Sand-57 appears in the backlog, which is as expected.

When I click the "View in Issue Navigator" button, it brings up another browser tab with the Issue Navigator view.

Now, both Sand-56 and Sand-57 appear in the Issue Navigator list, which does not match the Backlog.

The filter that appears in Issue Navigator is:

Id = Sand-56 OR id = Sand-57 and sprint is empty ORDER BY Rank ASC

The reason that both appear is due to operator precedence.  I think that JIRA should have automatically added parentheses to the Issue Navigator view as follows:

(Id = Sand-56 OR id = Sand-57) and sprint is empty ORDER BY Rank ASC

If I now change my Agile Board filter as follows to incorporate the parentheses, then everything works as expected (i.e. only Sand-57 appears in the Issue Navigator view):

(Id = Sand-56 OR id = Sand-57) ORDER BY Rank ASC

The funkiness isn't over, though.  If I now go and view my board filter, the parentheses are gone:

Id = Sand-56 OR id = Sand-57 ORDER BY Rank ASC

However, if I to to my Backlog, click "View in Issue Navigator", then the filter that I see in Issue Navigator is this:

(Id = Sand-56 OR id = Sand-57) and sprint is empty ORDER BY Rank ASC

The parentheses are back!  This makes it challenging to differentiate between filters that have been set up to work around this issue by the addition of explicit parenthesis, and those that have not been set up.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator view of Agile Board Backlog differs from Backlog view due to operator precedence issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The kanban is used to visualize the progress we make during a sprint. Like many software development teams, we have QA verify every issue before closing it. So the workflow is: an issue starts open. A developer marks it in progress. The developer checks in a fix and marks it resolved. QA verifies a subsequent build and marks it closed.

We want to visualize this flow with four columns in the kanban board. That works fine unless you use this version widget, which has the limitation we discussed below. To workaround the version widget problem, we have to use only 3 columns, so we can't visualize the difference between resolved and closed, which makes us less effective.
fields.summary: Add ability to use additional column to visualize resolved vs closed issues on kanban board

h3. Summary
Viewing the Backlog with an empty sprint shows "An Error occurred" on screen:
!Screen Shot 2016-01-04 at 3.07.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

*Note:*

* JIRA v7.1.0-OD-03-048

* Firefox
* Internet Explorer

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Sample Scrum Project.

h4. Summary

When an issue is moved to an Empty Sprint/Backlog in the backlog mode of a Scrum board, the Rank value of the issue is unchanged because there's no issue to be compared with it the Sprint/Backlog where it's moved to. However, this is not documented anywhere.

h4. Suggestion

This should be documented clearly, otherwise confusion might be encountered when one views the board's filter query in Issue Navigator, in which the order of the issues might not be the same top-down order as what he/she sees in the backlog mode. A KB article has been created for this at:
* [Why an issue's Rank value is not changed when moved to an Empty Sprint/Backlog|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=794371351]
fields.summary: Document how Ranking works when issues are moved to an Empty Sprint/Backlog

h3. Problem Definition

Add a simplified way to restrict visibility on a Kanban board, making users able to see only the swimlanes their group should.

h3. Use Case Example

We use swimlanes to organize the requests by department, and would like to have the ability to only allow people from a given department to see that department's requests. In other words, tweak the visibility of the swimlanes. The team should be able to see all the swimlanes, the departments should be able to see only their one swimlane. I guess we could set up a number of boards, set filters, and give access to boards to do the same thing, but it would be more elegant to have one board that adjusts per the user department.
fields.summary: Restrict visibility for swimlanes on a Kanban Board

h3. Summary
Currently it is not possible to set the End Date for a sprint correctly. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the following to create a sprint POST /rest/agile/1.0/sprint
# Set the following parameters changing the Board ID to reflect a board on your instance
{code}
{
    "name": "sprint 1",
    "startDate": "2017-04-11T01:00:00.000+08:00",
    "endDate": "2017-06-20T05:00:00.000+08:00",
    "originBoardId": 5
}
{code}
# Send the request
# Go check in JIRA UI, the board should have been created.
# Start the Sprint that you just created, which will prompt a dialog to set start and end date

h3. Expected Results
The start and end date should reflect the dates set

The end date is incorrect

h3.Workaround
After creation of the Sprint, update the Sprint with the POST /rest/agile/1.0/sprint/{sprintId}, and set end date. This will update the field correctly

fields.description:
We have been using Jira Agile/Kanban for many years now. We recently decided that the Agile board should really be ordered first by priority, then rank within the priority. We also use swimlanes based on Epics, to organize our current features at the top.

This means that stakeholders priority tickets are pushed to the top of our Kanban board view, which helps us plan out the most important work.
In other words, the agile board shows tickets in the same order as stakeholder priority, and works well:
project in (MyPrac, PWS) ORDER BY priority DESC, Rank ASC

Currently Jira does not allow  "Move to Top" or drag and drop tickets vertically in the Agile view, even though it does allow "Rank to Top" on individual tickets. (When viewing the as in: 
https://issues.practichem.com/browse/MyPrac-1234)
Steps to reproduce:
# Set up a Kanban board with a filter containing: ORDER BY priority DESC, Rank ASC
# In the view, attempt to drag and drop the ticket vertically to adjust rank.
# Or, Click on the ticket, observe that the side panel shows more ticket information on the right, then click on ... for additional actions, and then click "Move to Top"
# Observe that Jira does not adjust the rank, and that it displays an error:
# Ranking is disabled, as the Filter Query for this board is not ordered by ascending Rank. Please check your filter configuration.
# Expect that Jira moves the ticket to the top of the rank within the given priority. I'd be fine with a warning, if you want. 

There isn't any real reason to block the re-rank completely, since this is a scenario where we are using "atypical" queries. When people do use these ordering schemes, Jira should still allow the adjustment, as much as possible.

Since Rank is still relevant, and still part of the query (Rank ASC), I should be able to change the rank within a priority. (Rank to Top vs Move to Top). 
Of course, I don't expect that drag and drop or "Move to Top" should affect priority. Without this, organizing rank of tickets becomes quite tedious.
fields.summary: I should be able to adjust rank within Jira Agile, even if my query first orders by priority, then by rank

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sprint suggested naming does not take in account that the number listed could be a date range. 

Example: 

Sprint 1 12/31 - 1/06 (user entered)
Sprint 2 1/07-1/29 (user entered)
Sprint 2 1/07-1/30 (JIRA suggested)
Sprint 2 1/07-1/31 (JIRA suggested)
Sprint 2 1/07-1/32 (JIRA suggested)
etc....

h3. Suggested Solution

Create smarter sprint naming. Similar to this feature request for naming: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5125. A good feature would allow user to select *Create Sprint* and the sprint number would advances as well as date range (following the previous sprint's date trend)


h3. Workaround 

Current workaround is to manually change the Sprint name when creating one to fit naming convention used in previous sprints.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A Javascript error is thrown when the 'Where is my field?' option is clicked. This happens in the Quick Create Issue screen, as well as from the Create Epic screen both on an Agile Board.
h3. Environment

JIRA Software 7.0.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce for creating issue:
 # Navigate to a Scrum board and trigger the Inline Issue Create.
 # Open the Create Issue dialogue
 # Trigger the 'Where is my field?' option

h3. Steps to Reproduce for creating epic:
 # Navigate to a Scrum board 
 # from the backlog select Epic, create Epic
 # Click the Configure Fields, and select 'Where is my field?' option

h3. Expected Results

'Where is my field?' screen shows up
h3. Actual Results

The following Javascript error is thrown from issue creation:
{noformat}
Exception: Uncaught Uknown current dialog ID: prefillable-create-issue-dialog
{noformat}
!javascript.png|thumbnail!

The following javascript is thrown from epic creation:
{code:java}
Exception: Uncaught Uknown current dialog ID: create-epic-issue-dialog
{code}
h3.  Screencast

[http://screencast.com/t/9cvP3VFc65]
h3. Workaround
* Instead of using the Board to create the Epic, use the Create Button in the top navigation bar to create the Epic.   Following this method will permit you to use the 'Where is my field?' dialog without generating this error.
 !createworkaround1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Javascript error when using 'Where is my field?' in Create Issue screen from Agile's quick Create Issue

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# open a Scrum board -> Backlog
# select multiple issues -> Right-click
# choose either View in Issue Navigator or View in Excel

h4. +Expected behavior+
The Issue Navigator should display the selected issues according to their Rank order, like how they appear in the Backlog:
!backlog.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Actual behavior+
The Issue Navigator sorts the issues according to their issue keys, descending order:
!issuenav.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
# Since this might be by design, this ticket is created as a Suggestion, not a Bug
# Since Excel is indeed generated from Issue Navigator, it inherits the unwanted order

h4. +Workaround for exporting to Excel+
# View in Issue Navigator first
# When in Issue Navigator, amend the JQL by adding {{ORDER BY Rank ASC}}, then Export to Excel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a Board's Configuration > Columns page, the mapped statuses in the columns have the option of "drag to rearrange". However, whether you try to drag up or down any number of positions, all that happens is that one being dragged moves to the bottom of the list. Therefore, the only way to reorder all of them as you want is to work down the list, and one by one "drag" a status so that it gets sent to the bottom and try to keep doing this so that eventually you get the order you want by not dragging one of them once it's in the position you want.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Board's Configuration > Columns page;
# Make sure that you have at least 3 status mapped to one column and rearrange the top status to the middle position.

h3. Expected Results
* To get the top status into the middle position.

h3. Actual Results
* It goes to the bottom position.
fields.summary: Mapped statuses in the Board > Configure > Columns page only moves them to the bottom of the column

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user restores a Cloud backup on to the latest JIRA Server, they get a warning banner letting them know JIRA Software is unavailable:
{quote}_"JIRA Software is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not yet completed. Please contact your system administrator if you continue to see this message."_{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a fresh backup From JIRA Cloud that has JIRA Software.
# Install the latest available version of JIRA Software(7.0.4 as of time of this test).
# Restore the backup once you are done installing.
(i) When restoring, you would get an error informing you that you are installing data from a newer JIRA instance on an older one as well as one asking you to enter license. Enter the license in the available section and click proceed anyway and proceed to restore again.
# JIRA should restore and ask you to login.

h3. Expected Result
Everything works as it should as JIRA did not throw any warning while you were restoring the data.

h3. Actual Result
JIRA would show you a banner saying JIRA Software is unavailable.

h3. Workaround

Please raise a support case at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] if you experience any problems with this, and we can provide workaround steps.

h3. Notes

I have tested this and ensured that JIRA Software was installed however the issue still persisted. Likely caused by a downgrade of the JIRA Software version during the restore.

* No error in the logs.
* It seems like all upgrade tasks were running fine {noformat}

fields.description:
Agile reports ignored initial story point once it is cleared from Done issues if there's no other issue history earlier on rather than the history for clearing story point.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create 3 issues *A*, *B* and *C* with story point set to 1, 2 and 3 respectively.
* Create a sprint in the project's Scrum board.
* Before adding the issues into the sprint, edit the story point for issue *A* and *C* to 3 and 1 respectively (*A* with 3 points and *C* with 1 points now).
* Drag the issues into the sprint and start it.
* Drag the issues to Done in the Scrum board and complete the sprint.
* Check the reports e.g. burndown chart and velocity chart. Total story point should be 6.
* Now, edit those 3 issues and remove their story point or set it to 0.
* Check the charts again and total will be 4. Story point for issue *B* where there's no change to story point is considered as empty in the charts but not for *A* and *C*.

Note: The action of clearing story point after issues set to Done is to reflect the same *Update from date* action via JIRA Porfolio. This is an action that will be performed in JIRA Portfolio frequently.
fields.summary: Agile reports ignored initial story point once it is cleared from Done issues

In the Project Releases page there are two quick filters, Released and Unreleased.

!172266.png|thumbnail!

As a user I would like to add new quick filters to this page and/or change the quick filters query.
fields.summary: Allow customization of the project releases page quick filters.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I release a project through Jira I have the choice of choosing to kick off a new Bamboo build with the release.  Part of this action is the option to "Override variable" for the build plan.  This works fine the first time the release is attempted.  If the build ends up failing, when you Retry Release through Jira, the Override variable is automatically filled out with the value from the first run.

The bug is that with this automatically filled out override variable is not actually passed to the Bamboo build plan.  It ends up using the default instead.

The workaround is to make sure you delete and re-add the override variable when you retry a Jira release.
fields.summary: Bamboo variable override isn't passed along when a Jira Release is retried

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a scrum project
# Have a board with at least one unmaped status
# Start a sprint
# Move tickets around and set one ticket to that unmaped status
# Close the sprint
# Check the Sprint Report

*Expected Results:*
At Sprint Report the field status should display the actual value of the ticket.

*Actual Results:*
The Sprint Report is showing the field status with other value.
See:
 !Screen Shot 2015-12-09 at 2.32.43 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2015-12-09 at 2.32.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA v7.1.0-OD-02-030
JIRA Agile v7.1.9-D20151208T191112

*Notes:*
It's possible that JIRA is taking the status before the ticket was removed from the sprint to display on the report. Though, it should reflect the actual status of the ticket.
fields.summary: At Sprint Report the field status do not reflect the actual value of the ticket

fields.description:
My understanding of an *Epic* is very different to my understanding of a *Theme*. I would define these as:

_An *Epic* describes a number of *Stories* all of which must be delivered in order to gain the benefit described by the *Epic*. Or to put it another way, all *Stories* in an *Epic* would be delivered into a live environment at the same time because they have limited value in their own right._

_A *Theme* describes a common goal or idea which applies to many *Stories*. All of the *Stories* within an *Theme* are independent of the *Theme*. That is to say, the *Stories* do not all need to be delivered together._

This can be achieved to an extent in JIRA using the labels field or a custom 'Theme' label field to record *Themes*. However it does not allow us to record any detail about the *Theme*.

This can also be achieved by using an *Epic* as though it were a *Theme*. But this prevents a *Story* from being in both a *Theme* and an *Epic* because the *Epic Link* only allows one *Theme*. The other problem is that a *Theme* isn't really an issue type, in that it would never want to be closed, you don't deliver a *Theme* but you do deliver an *Epic*.

I believe *Themes* should be catered for in JIRA very differently to a normal Issue. I have yet to find a satisfactory lo-fi solution to this. I therefore believe *Themes* should be introduced as a top level concept into JIRA.
fields.summary: Introduce Themes separately from Epics
